Shengfeng Han; Guoping Liu; Hui Qiao; Zheng Li; Zelong Duan; Qiang Sun
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2024.3400531
Volume PP

As the pumped storage (PS) units have the characteristics of low life cycle cost and environmental friendliness, in order to reduce operation costs and pollutant gas emissions of micro-energy grid (MEG), a low-carbon and economic optimal dispatching method of MEG considering PS and comprehensive demand response (DR) is proposed in this paper. First of all, the mathematical models of photovoltaic c...

item.title: Semi-Supervised Approach for Automatic Counting of Whiteflies with Small Annotated Dataset
item.description:
Semi-Supervised Approach for Automatic Counting of Whiteflies with Small Annotated Dataset

Laura Gomez-Zamanillo; Arantza Bereciartua-Perez; Andoni Elola; Artzai Picon; Aitor Alvarez-Gila; Itziar Egusquiza; Ramon Navarra-Mestre
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3552195
Volume PP

Insect counting is key action for pests' control in agriculture. Automatic insect counting would allow a fast and accurate characterization of the infestation degree which would lead to a better choice of insecticide dose and, consequently, more effective treatments. Recently, an approach that automatically counts the insects in the wild has been proposed [1]. That method is based on density map e...

item.title: Mean Square Couple-Group Consensus of a Kind of Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems With Time Delay and Markov Switching
item.description:
Mean Square Couple-Group Consensus of a Kind of Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems With Time Delay and Markov Switching

Xin Zhang; Xingcheng Pu; Liangzhi Xu; Yongfeng Wu
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3532955
Volume PP

This study focuses on the mean square couple-group consensus of a heterogeneous multi-agent system with time delay and Markov switching. Based on heterogeneity, time delay, competitive-cooperative relations, and stochastic switching, new protocols have been developed to achieve the mean square couple-group consensus of this system. Sufficient conditions have been achieved for the mean square coupl...

item.title: The Cross Section of AI and Sustainability: Extensive Topic Modeling of Ten Years of Research
item.description:
The Cross Section of AI and Sustainability: Extensive Topic Modeling of Ten Years of Research

Hyung Jun Ahn
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3552974
Volume PP

The rapid advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) are driving innovation and providing new tools to enhance sustainable practices across various domains. However, the swift progression of AI also presents new sustainability challenges, particularly concerning its carbon footprint and resource consumption. To explore the complex research landscape at the intersection of AI and sustainability, ...

item.title: Smooth Guided Adversarial Fully Test-time Adaptation
item.description:
Smooth Guided Adversarial Fully Test-time Adaptation

Dong Li; Panfei Yang
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2024.3432197
Volume PP

Fully test-time adaptation (FTTA) refers to a specific type of domain adaptation that involves adjusting a pre-trained machine learning model to work with a new target domain, without accessing any data from the source domain. The lack of access to source data makes it more difficult to adjust to the target domain. Therefore, it is generally considered as a more challenging task than unsupervised ...

item.title: Condensing Video Content: Deep Learning Advancements and Challenges in Video Summarization Innovations
item.description:
Condensing Video Content: Deep Learning Advancements and Challenges in Video Summarization Innovations

Faryal Shamsi; Irum Sindhu
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3526068
Volume PP

With the rapid growth of social media platforms, the volume of video content on the internet has increased exponentially. YouTube, the most popular social networking platform, manages over 500 hours of video uploads every minute. Indexing, retrieving, navigating, and searching this vast collection of video data pose significant challenges. Existing video indexing techniques largely depend on user-...

item.title: Dimensional-Based Methods for Topological Management in Underwater Wireless Sensor Networks: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description:
Dimensional-Based Methods for Topological Management in Underwater Wireless Sensor Networks: A Comprehensive Survey

Meena Pundir; Jasminder Kaur Sandhu; Sapna Juneja; Deepali Gupta; Ghadir Altuwaijri; Ali Nauman
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3546978
Volume PP

Most topology control algorithms consider a 2-D plane in terrestrial Wireless Sensor Networks. However, this is not the case in Underwater Wireless Sensor Networks (UWSN). Due to the underwater current, the node’s positions constantly flux. It is a significant challenge to satisfy the deployment of nodes precisely underwater for reliable communication. A three-dimensional (3-D) network is created ...

item.title: Contrastive Feature Bin Loss for Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description:
Contrastive Feature Bin Loss for Monocular Depth Estimation

Jihun Song; Yoonsuk Hyun
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3551435
Volume PP

Recently monocular depth estimation has achieved notable performance using encoder-decoder-based models. These models have utilized the Scale-Invariant Logarithmic (SILog) loss for effective training, leading to significant performance improvements. However, the SILog loss may potentially misguide the model due to its design. To address this problem, we propose the Contrastive Feature Bin (CFB) lo...

item.title: Gyromagnetics of the electron clock
item.description:
Gyromagnetics of the electron clock

David Hestenes
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3544654
Volume PP

The Dirac equation is presented as a complete theory of the electron as a gyromagnetic particle clock with precise physical interpretation for all degrees of freedom. The electron is modeled as a point charge with toroidal zitter and variable zilch. That is to say, the charge oscillates at the speed of light on a torus centered on a circular orbit around its center of mass z = z(t), with an axis a...

item.title: DMFFNet: Dual-Mode Multi-Scale Feature Fusion-Based Pedestrian Detection Method
item.description:
DMFFNet: Dual-Mode Multi-Scale Feature Fusion-Based Pedestrian Detection Method

Ruizhe Hu; Ting Rui; Yan Ouyang; Jinkang Wang; Qunyan Jiang; Yinan Du
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2022.3185986
Volume PP

Most contemporary pedestrian detection algorithms are based on visible light image detection. However, in environments with dim light, small targets, and easily occluded and cluttered backgrounds, single-mode visible light images relying on color, texture, and other features cannot adequately represent the feature information of targets; as a result, a large number of targets are lost and the algo...

item.title: Comparative Analysis of Predicting Malware Attack Trends in Cyber Supply Chain Using Multiple Classification Models
item.description:
Comparative Analysis of Predicting Malware Attack Trends in Cyber Supply Chain Using Multiple Classification Models

Shubo Li
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2024.3471802
Volume PP

This paper investigates the prediction of malware attack trends within the cyber supply chain domain using data sourced from Microsoft Malware Prediction and Research Prediction for the year 2019. Various machine learning models, including XGBoost, Support Vector Classification (SVC), Extra Tree, K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Gradient Boosting, and a four-layer Neural Network, were trained and evalua...

item.title: Revisiting ONE Simulator in IoV Research: Seeing the Forest Through the Trees

https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2025.3552026

The Internet of Vehicles (IoV) refers to a large-scale distributed system that can be considered as the convergence of the mobile Internet and the Internet of Things (IoT).
